required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment for Aerobic Vaginitis by Using Bofukang Vaginal Suppository
clinical_study.official_title: Medical Ethics Committee of Peking University Shenzhen Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Aerobic vaginitis was treated by using Baofukang Suppository 7 days group or Baofukang Suppository 14 days group.To evaluate the efficacy and safety after treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aerobic vaginitis was treated by using Baofukang Suppository 7 days group or Baofukang Suppository 14 days group.
Group 1: Baofukang Suppository (1.74g), for vaginal use, 2 capsules per night for 7 days.
Group 2: Baofukang Suppository (1.74g), for vaginal use, 2 capsules per night for 14 days.
The efficacy and safety will be evaluated 7~14 days after treatment and 35~42 days after treatment.

primary_outcome.description: A vaginal smear composite Donders score of 1 to 2 represents normality. A score of more than 2 is aerobic vaginitis. There are four variables(Lactobacillary; leucocytes; toxic leukocytes; parabasal cells; background flora). Detail see references Links.

A vaginal smear composite Donders score of 1 to 2 represents normality. A score of more than 2 is aerobic vaginitis. There are four variables(Lactobacillary; leucocytes; toxic leukocytes; parabasal cells; background flora).Detail see folowing references.

secondary_outcome.description: Number of Participants Experiencing AEs Following the First Dose of the Study Product

arm_group.description: Baofukang Suppository (1.74g), for vaginal external use, 2 capsules per night for 7 days
Baofukang Suppository (1.74g), for vaginal external use, 2 capsules per night for 14days

overall_official.affiliation: Dept of Obstetrics and Gynecology,Peking University Shenzhen Hospital
